titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: I attended service in the chapel, & thought much of the former times, 29 years ago, when first I used to do so. Should I not have been a happier man, & more useful, if I had stayed on in Oxford?
I walked to Christ Church, & called on Watson, with whom I had some talk.

p.hi: Then I walked to 11 Fryfield Road, & lunched with Harry Davis & his wife.

We went together to the Sheldonian to vote on the Divinity Degrees statutes. The crowd was so great that we could not gain admission. There had been a mighty gathering of Obscurantists from every Temple of Bigotry in the country. The statutes were thrown out by great majorities.

body.p: After sending telegrams to Watkins & Tucker, I walked to Magdalen, & had tea with Olaf Car√∂e. We walked together round Magdalen Walks twice, & got under cover only just in time to escape a violent thunderstorm.
